English content:
In a huge battle against viruses, some people were put in an awkward and grey situation.
The reporter of “Portrait” interviewed the family members of 3 dialysis patients in COVID-19 epidemic, and one family member said: "In this process, everyone always sees the main body. Indeed, there are many people under the shadow of cracks. In fact, there are not a few of them. If you count the number of them, it is really a lot.” 

Written by｜Jing Xinyu, An Xiaoqing
Editted by｜Tang Qi

“Please help our family, we really cannot find any other methods.”
On the morning of January 1, the citizen Zhou Zhe in Wuhan typed out the first line of words on his Weibo for helping his father. 
Zhou Zhe's father is a dialysis patient and needs to go to Wugang Hospital for dialysis three times a week.
He recalled that, a week ago, his father was in a state of high fever, vomiting and general weakness. He suspected that his father was infected with COVID-19 because "he didn't know the seriousness of the problem at the early stage and didn't wear any protective measures such as a mask when he went to the hospital for dialysis".
In the next three days, Zhou Zhe's father was diagnosed as "highly suspected" by doctors. However, due to the shortage of test kits, the original dialysis hospital refused to carry out follow-up dialysis treatment for the elderly, and he could not be accepted by the designated hospital in COVID-19 because he could not be diagnosed.
Hemodialysis is a routine treatment for acute and chronic kidney failure.
Excess water and toxins are removed by taking blood out of the body and using the principles of dialysis and filtration, and then injected into the patient.
Dialysis patients usually go to the hospital dialysis room for dialysis once or three times a week according to the doctor's advice, each time for 3 to 4 hours.
Except kidney transplant patients, all patients with kidney failure need lifelong dialysis.
Once dialysis is interrupted, it may endanger life safety.
Zhou Zhe recalled that, in those days, they sought medical treatment everywhere every day. "Like a mobile source of infection, we were afraid of infecting other people, but there was really nothing we could do. 」
On February 2, Zhou Zhe's father finally queued in the hospital for nucleic acid test, but before the test results came out, the old man died unfortunately on the morning of February 3.
Great changes, which are equally severe and rapid, also occurred in Fang Hui's family.
Since February 1, Fang Hui has been looking for a bed for father who is suspected to be infected with COVID-19 and needs dialysis daily.
Fang Hui told “Portrait” that the father needed to go to Hubei Provincial Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine for dialysis twice a week because of diabetic kidney failure.

Three weeks ago, the mother who went to dialysis with father had fever and fatigue, and CT showed that her lungs were infected. However, because she could not be diagnosed, her condition turned sharply within eight days, and unfortunately she died in the early morning of January 31.
The next day, Fang Hui, who had not yet emerged from the grief of her mother's sudden death, took her father to the hospital for ruling out and found that father's lungs were also infected (later diagnosed as Covid-19).
The hospital refused Fang Hui's father's request to continue the next dialysis because the hospital was not the designated one for Covid-19.
Fang Hui went to several designated hospitals for COVID-19 that can implement dialysis as mentioned in previous government documents. "Some said that the hospital area is still undergoing renovation, and they don't have the conditions. Some of them have no available beds. I have been running for 8 days, but there was still no bed. At midnight yesterday, the community informed us to go to the hospital for hospitalization. The hospital said that they didn't know who the docking person was and couldn't be treated.
"We'll report it, wait for the news." This sentence will always be given to you.
Can only continue to wait, there is no other method.
As Wuhan has "banned cars" and the traffic is inconvenient, Fang Hui can only ride a shared electric scooter between hospital and home every time.
One-day last week, he took his father to the hospital for dialysis. "I rode a shared electric car for almost two hours, and changed three times in the middle. I was fine, and my dad was tortured to death.”
For more than 10,000 patients with kidney disease who need to go to hospital for dialysis regularly in Wuhan, the spread of the epidemic, the high risk of infection, the lockdown of the city and the consequent ban on private cars have thrown them into an embarrassing situation and a grey interval.
Zhi An, the initiator of the non-profit organization "Kidney·Like People", told “Portrait” that for ordinary dialysis patients who are not infected with COVID-19, dialysis is basically no longer a problem with the requisitioned hospitals opening dialysis rooms one after another under the appeal of patients, non-profit organizations and media reports. The currently urgent problem lies in materials and travel.
“For example, the masks.
Three masks are needed for one dialysis (It takes about 3-4 hours to one dialysis. It needs one mask in the dialysis room and one on each way back and forth.) Many patients don't have masks anymore ... Others can stay at home for a week, and stay for ten days or half a month without going out. That's no problem, but they can't.
If they don't go to dialysis, they can't sustain their lives.” Zhi An said.
However, Zhi An told “Portrait” that for many dialysis patients who have been diagnosed or suspected of COVID-19, "they are in dilemma.” It’s especially hard to find bed.”
At present, Wuhan has arranged 7 designated hospitals for patients with kidney failure and hemodialysis.
However, according to the accounts of many renal dialysis patients, hospitals do not accept individuals and need community referral.
In recent days, the beds in these hospitals are basically full.
In addition, in the interview, “Portrait” also learned about the plight of another special group - some people with chronic kidney disease, because of long-term lung effusion, chronic lung inflammation existed for a long time.
However, in this special period when all the symptoms related to "lung" will attract attention, they are required to do nucleic acid tests repeatedly to prove that they are not infected with COVID-19.
They did, but they were told that the accuracy of nucleic acid test is still to be considered.
They were unable to go to 7 designated hospitals and were not admitted to ordinary dialysis rooms.
They became real people who had nowhere to go for dialysis.
In a huge battle against viruses, some people were put in an awkward and grey situation.
The reporter of “Portrait” interviewed the family members of 3 dialysis patients in COVID-19 epidemic, and one family member said: "In this process, everyone always sees the main body. Indeed, there are many people under the shadow of cracks. In fact, there are not a few of them. If you count the number of them, it is really a lot. “
1
The following is Lu Fan's self-statement.
His grandmother superimposed suspected COVID-19 patients for dialysis patients, and died at home on February 5.
My grandmother is 78 years old and has been undergoing dialysis for 3 years. She goes to Zhongnan Hospital affiliated to Wuhan University for dialysis 3 times a week.
At the beginning of January, Grandma began to have a fever and felt uncomfortable. After going to the hospital for examination, she said that her lungs were infected. At that time, COVID-19 had not yet fully erupted, and she stayed in the hospital for about 7 or 8 days. When the fever was gone, the hospital let her go out of the hospital, but the problem of lung infection was not completely solved, just that the situation improved.
On January 25, Grandma began to have a fever again. At that time, COVID-19 had already broken out, and we were very afraid, because she had to go to the hospital for dialysis 3 times a week, and the dialysis room was full of patients with poor immunity.
So we were worried about whether it was COVID-19, so we took grandma to Zhongnan Hospital for CT and blood test.
The CT result was highly suspected of COVID-19, but Zhongnan Hospital didn't have a test kit at that time and couldn't do nucleic acid test, so let us go home and quarantine ourselves.
Grandma's condition is getting worse every day, and Zhongnan Hospital has refused to let my grandmother go to dialysis since February 1.
The reason for rejection is that the dialysis ward of Zhongnan Hospital does not have an quarantined dialysis ward for Covid-19 patients. If COVID-19 goes in for dialysis, more than a dozen people in a big room may infect other people.
Without regular dialysis, grandma's body collapsed very quickly.
My family went to Liyuan Hospital affiliated to Huake, where a batch of kits just arrived.
Originally the result should be taken on the next day, however, on the next day, Liyuan Hospital said the test result was missed, then we did the test again.
At that time, grandma was exhausted and needed a lift, couldn’t go upstairs nor walk.
Waiting for another day, the result showed that it was negative.
We were very happy. We took Grandma to Zhongnan Hospital with the results, hoping that Grandma could be hospitalized and continue dialysis.
But the director of Nephrology Department of Zhongnan Hospital looked at our nucleic acid test results and then looked at CT. His original words were, "Through this CT observation, I think this is basically COVID-19.
I don't quite agree with the results of this nucleic acid test, which has certain errors. “
Therefore, he refused to receive my grandma for treatment.
I didn’t blame him.
Later, a friend of mine in a hospital told me that the accuracy of the nucleic acid test kit was not high.
I didn't know how many families delayed the treatment opportunity because of this kit, and how many medical staff were infected because of the wrong test kit.
After the doctor said that he didn't recognize the result, asked us to go to the 7 designated hospitals in Wuhan to have another test.
But on the afternoon when we went to Zhongnan Hospital to see him, Grandma was in a coma, and we couldn't do another nucleic acid test, and she was already in shock.
The doctor said there was nothing he could do, because there was no bed and no medical resources, and he couldn't treat, so we had to find our own way.
During this period, we contacted the community, and the community contacted the Health Commission for us. The Health and Health Commission told us through the community that there was nothing they could do, because there was really no bed and no rescue power.
We have contacted many hospitals by ourselves, but ordinary hospitals didn't accept patients with fever. They all said that my grandmother is a suspected COVID-19 patient, and she needed to go to a designated hospital.
We contacted the designated hospital for COVID-19, and they said that Grandma had not been diagnosed and could not accept her.
It was in an endless loop, all hospitals didn't accept her.
My grandma was like in the grey zone of crack.
We also called 120, and were saying that the patient was in shock, the situation was very critical, and we needed first aid. The answer given to us by 120 was that there was nothing they could do. They said that the premise of the ambulance coming was that we had to find a hospital willing to treat grandma, then they could come, otherwise there would be no place to go when the ambulance came.
He said that they have seen too much recently. They once took a patient to 3 or 4 hospitals, and all of them were turned away.
From the afternoon of February 4 to the present (afternoon of February 5), Grandma could only lie at home, and has no response. She had no response, only breathing, and couldn't eat or drink water.
(Editor's Note: On the afternoon of February 5, the National Health Commission of People’s Republic of China issued the "Diagnosis and Treatment Plan for Pneumonia Infected with COVID-19 (Trial Fifth Edition)", which stipulated that CT imaging results should be taken as the diagnostic criteria for clinical diagnosis cases in Hubei Province. )
Including myself entering some help groups, QQ groups and WeChat groups, many cases are similar to ours, namely, many patients who are not from COVID-19 (with other diseases) are also asking for help because he cannot get a basic treatment guarantee.
Before the lungs were infected, my grandmother was in good health. She had no problem taking a bath and eating by herself, and her self-care ability was OK.
But since the outbreak, there have been lots of sudden changes in life.
This change is very fast and a bit unreal.
Because on the Chinese New Year's Eve, Grandma had dinner with us.
My two children, twins, have just been born for 3 months. Grandma has an old idea that she has been undergoing dialysis and is a patient. It is not good for her to see babies, so on Chinese New Year's Eve it was the first time she saw and held babies.
At that time, my family also said that I would find a photo studio to take a family photo of 4 generations, but it didn't work out, which is a great regret for me.
The whole thing was developing so fast that it really felt like a wartime state now.
This was also a shame.
Because of kids’ birth, the family told me to go to the hospital less and meet with everyone less.
Before I had no children, my cousin and I took turns to pick up my grandma for dialysis.
After the outbreak of COVID-19, my family wouldn't let me go, because there was a certain risk. If I got sick, I might be fine when I was young, but it was a great risk to bring it back to my babies.
So I haven’t met my grandma for long time.
Even right now, she is in shock, lying down and dying at home, I really want to see her, but my reason tells me to forget it.
I felt very sad.
Actually, before the outbreak, my wife and I felt something was wrong in the hospital.
At the end of December last year, my wife and I went to the hospital for postpartum examination. At that time, COVID-19 had already attracted the attention of the hospital, because at that time, a separate fever clinic had been set up, and the number of people waiting in line for CT was several times as high as before. In addition, the protective measures of medical staff had been put on masks, but at that time, we could not feel this abnormality and tension at home.
I couldn't feel it when I walked on the road, because it was rare to see someone wearing a mask.
At that time, I felt a little strange when I was in the hospital, because there were some news on the Internet at that time, so after we went home, we both felt that this matter might not be as small and easy as we seemed and felt, and there might be some serious problems.
At that time, we began to dissuade our elders from going out less and never going out to play cards. We stopped our elders earlier.
Therefore, before the outbreak, they began to pay more attention, and we also started to hoard some masks, alcohol and 84 disinfectant very early.
In fact, gossip spread faster than official news. We received a lot of gossip, including WeChat official accounts and messages between friends. At that time, we desperately sent it to our elders.
I thought we were experiencing a history, and this year is definitely a history.
Even when SARS happened, it was said lockdown of city, but it did not really happen.
But now, Wuhan was firmly locked down, and not only Wuhan was locked down, but the whole Hubei Province was locked down, so what we have experienced must be history, and in this historical event, we have lost our loved ones and experienced these dangers. In this tense time, as a person, I thought we should not forget this matter.
Among my relatives, friends, classmates and people I know, there were infected and diagnosed people in almost every family.
I was very closed to my grandma.
She has been sent to dialysis by me every week for the past 3 years.
Frankly, if you haven't seen it, when you see the dialysis room for the first time, the impact was very big. It was the feeling that people's blood is pumped out of the body, passed through the machine and then inject into it. There is a feeling that people are separated alive, and then washed and stuffed into it.
But there was no way for this conventional treatment to continue now.
In this process, the focus that everyone always saw was the main body. In fact, there were many people under the shadow of cracks. In fact, there were not a few of these people. If you counted the number of them, it was really too many.
(Editor's Note: 8 hours after the interview ended on the afternoon of February 5, Lu Fan told “Portrait” on WeChat: My grandmother just passed away, thank you for your attention.
It should be useful with the media's attention and online help. The District Health Commission told us at night that the hospitalization list had been opened, but grandma couldn't wait. )

2
The following is Zhang Qiong's self-statement. Her mother Wei Ruzhen was unable to continue dialysis in the original hospital because of chronic pneumonia.
My mother is 79 years old in this year and has uremia and various basic diseases. She has been undergoing kidney dialysis for a long time, 3 times a week.
She had been doing dialysis in Wuhan Tianyou Hospital before. After this hospital was collected as the 3rd batch of designated fever hospital, the dialysis room was closed, and my mother was transferred to Huangjiahu Branch of Wuhan University of Science and Technology Affiliated Hospital for dialysis.
When we got there, the hospital asked us to take CT and take blood tests. After doing it, we found that my mother's lungs were inflamed.
She did have chronic pneumonia in her lungs, which happened when she was hospitalized for heart failure 3 years ago. At that time, the doctor said that every organ of her body was failing, so it was normal to have inflammation.
Huangjiahu Hospital asked my mother to do nucleic acid identification, so we lined up at People's Hospital all night. My spouse and I lined up to let my mother rest in the car.
The result appeared as negative, so we took the result back to Huangjiahu Hospital and gave us dialysis that time (February 1).
On the February 4, we went to dialysis again, and the hospital asked us to take another film. CT showed no change compared with before, and asked us to do nucleic acid test. I had to take my mother to the doctor and ask them to diagnose as cough (the symptom that she didn’t have) for my mother, so that I could be qualified for nucleic acid test.
We did it twice that day, once in the No.7 Hospital and once in the People's Hospital, and the results were all negative.
On the February 5, we returned to Huangjiahu Hospital with the results. I said my mother would be dead without dialysis. They called the clinical laboratory of CT and then gave dialysis. When I made an appointment for the next time, the hospital said that it was absolutely impossible. As long as there was inflammation in the lungs, we would not accept.
I called the hospital leaders, and they said they would have a meeting to study it. After more than two hours, a secretary called me and said that to be on the safe side, dialysis would not be given as long as there was pneumonia.
My mother didn't have fever, cough, shortness of breath, and has no symptoms (COVID-19).
No matter how many times you did the nucleic acid test, even all results were negative and you will not be accepted.
He didn't accept nucleic acid test now. He only looked at chest X-ray and didn't accept as long as there was inflammation.
On the morning of February 6, I ran dialysis rooms in several hospitals, there were some private hospitals and designated hospitals, I was pointed out everywhere. You went there to ask, you went there to ask, and when you asked the right place, they even didn't ask me what happened, so they just said that the hospital bed was full and they couldn’t accept.
I was also very considerate of them. All nurses worked in 3 shifts, and they were still doing dialysis from 8: 00AM to 10: 00PM.
I called the hotline of the mayor of Wuhan, the Municipal Health Commission and the District Health Commission. I called all the hotlines, and I ran away from the hospitals where I could run.
Every time the health commission calls, it says that they should report, and then it will be solved for you. The community’s response is the same as the hotline. Reply after reporting, then there would be no following.
On one time, the person who answered the phone of the Health Commission told me, "Tell the hospital to study the ‘Notice on Doing a Good Job of Medical Security for Special Patients during the COVID-19 Outbreak’. “
I was in distress situation. I am a citizen. I read the document to them. Now they simply ignore me. What's the point?
My mother has been suffering from diabetes for more than 20 years. Complications include coronary heart disease and uremia. All organs of her body are failing, including inflammation of her urinary tract and lung.
Recently, she couldn't get dialysis in time. When the water in her body was much, her body swelled. After swelling, the water oppressed her heart, which made her heart uncomfortable.
There was water in the lungs.
She would continue to have inflammation.
If a patient like her couldn't get dialysis, it would last a week at most.
Sometimes I ate two dumplings a day, but I was not hungry, because I was really in a hurry, and I couldn’t eat anything.
I couldn’t fall asleep at night.
My mother was very anxious, too. She said that I would stop dialysis, and she was afraid that we would be infected.
I had to reassure her that I’ll try to find it. You'll be fine. There will always be a place to help you with dialysis.
Patients with COVID-19 were very poor. They really needed treatment, but these dialysis patients are human beings and 
(Editor's Note: On February 8, Zhang Qiong found a private hemodialysis center in Hanyang to dialysis her mother at her own expense. "I am grateful to have a place to give her dialysis," she said.
The frequency of dialysis was reduced to twice a week, and she told her mother to try to control water intake.
What Zhang Qiong is praying now is that they will not be rejected by this private hemodialysis center on Thursday, February 13.)
3

The following is Dong Xue's self-statement.
She is a 25-year-old girl born and raised in Wuhan.
Her father suffered from lung inflammation, and at the same time, the kidney transplanted for 9 months showed rejection reaction, and died without any intubation.
My father, aged 51, had a kidney transplant in Tongji Hospital, Hankou 9 months ago. After that, his condition recovered well, which was higher than the average of ordinary kidney transplantation in the same period.
But there was something wrong with his lungs. One was that the previous dialysis caused hydrops due to improper operation. At that time, about 0.5 kilogram of blood was pumped out.
During kidney transplantation, the lung produced nodules again, and there has been a root cause of the lung since then.
On January 15, my father started to have a fever and took antipyretics. On January 18, he went to the hospital. The respiratory department of Tongji Hospital in Hankou ruled out the possibility of COVID-19. The kidney transplant doctor suggested that we should go to hospital for emergency injection to suppress pneumonia.
We also got the hospitalization certificate, but at the same time, the control of the epidemic situation in Wuhan began to tighten. The hospital said that my father had inflammation in the lungs and could not be accepted. Asked us to go home and take medicine for our own treatment, and wait until the epidemic situation stabilizes before being hospitalized.
After that, we contacted Tongji Hospital all the time and wanted to be hospitalized. Without success, we just asked us to take IV, and we went to the community hospital for IV.
While treating pneumonia, we also stopped anti-rejection drugs according to the doctor's advice, because anti-rejection drugs, contrary to antibiotics for treating pneumonia, reduce human immunity.
On the morning of February 1, my father had kidney rejection, and almost no urine, with the highest fever reaching 41 degrees and creatinine rising from 83 to 280.
After calling 120, they couldn't come. If we went to the hospital, we must go to the fever clinic for examination. We were afraid of being cross-infected, so we went home and contacted the community. They said that we could only be screened whether it is COVID-19 virus infection, and we couldn't do any kidney function related examination because of fever.
On the next day, because the situation was really urgent, we went to Optics Valley Tongji Hospital to have a nucleic acid test. I hoped that if we can confirm the diagnosis, we can go to a designated hospital for treatment. If it is negative, we can also go to a general hospital for treatment.
On that day, my father spent a whole day on IV in Optics Valley Tongji Hospital, including doing various examinations, and stayed in the hospital for more than 10 hours.
The result showed negative.
My mother stayed in Optics Valley Tongji Hospital for 10 hours and didn't see any doctors.
Because the medical personnel were busy dealing with COVID-19, they were overloaded and had no time to help my mother, and there were no doctors with relevant experience on duty in the hospital.
I heard that many COVID-19 patients with negative nucleic acid test were found clinically, which infected nurses and doctors. Therefore, my father now had neither a confirmed diagnosis nor a complete exclusion. We cannot go to either hospital. Even if we were looking for directions, we didn't know which direction to work hard.
In fact, we also asked respiratory experts in 2 or 3 big hospitals. They looked at my dad's CT trend in the past 20 days, and no doctor said it was like COVID-19.
It was not COVID-19, but we couldn't find a hospital.
My mother ran several non-designated hospitals these days, thinking about intubation first (before dialysis, patients with kidney disease need to be intubated at the vein to draw blood out of the body and transport it back to the body), and then once there was any situation, she could go to dialysis in time to save her life.
However, those non-designated hospitals, either the departments are closed, the smaller ones have no beds, and the smaller ones have no ability and conditions.
My father should go back to Tongji Hospital, Hankou, the first hospital in this special situation. I also understand that it is in the epidemic center, and it is really incapable of treating my father.
In Optics Valley Tongji Hospital, we also met a very enthusiastic young doctor before, saying that if our nucleic acid test results showed negative, they would be fine.
After the results come out, (pause), for various reasons, I may not know what the reason is, but it just goes away anyway.
He couldn’t help us.
At that time, I knew it was useless to send Weibo, but I hoped to let everyone know this matter as much as possible, see if it could be seen by relevant people one day, and then help this group of people.
I had a fever on the 28th day of Chinese New Year. I spent 10 hours in the Army General Hospital and had a CT scan. My lungs were slightly infected, and now it has basically improved.
But the doctor advised me to quarantine myself, so I lived in another house of our family, and only my mother drove my dad to the hospital every day.
I could only get to know the situation of my parents through WeChat every day.
My dad asked me not to go to hospital and visit him.
Our family used to have pets, so there was a camera in the living room, and I watched my father lie on the sofa every day.
They go out to the hospital at 8 o'clock every morning and come back at 11 o'clock at night at the latest.
I dared not to call them, because taking out cell phones in the hospital would increase the risk of infection.
Just look at the camera, when watching them to arrive home, wash their hands and disinfect them, and then I dared to call them.
I was afraid they were too anxious to answer the phone and forget to wash their hands.
In fact, if it wasn't during the epidemic, if my dad went to the hospital for dialysis and treatment in time, the kidneys and people could be insured, but now in this situation, there was no way to guarantee dialysis, and the tube couldn't be inserted, so there was no way.
My father had chronic nephritis since I could remember something, and then it got worse step by step until he had a kidney transplant last year.
My father always wanted to buy a house in Hainan, and lived in winter. Wuhan is too cold in winter, which is not suitable for patients like him.
Last year, my grandmother died on Chinese New Year's Eve, and we couldn't go back to my father's hometown Xiaogan. This year, because of his illness, we couldn't go back to Xiaogan either.
I won't catch a cold next year. My dad can realize his dream of wintering in Hainan. I believe so.
(Editor's Note: On the evening of February 4, Dong Xue's parents came home near midnight and found no place to intubate.
She couldn't quarantine herself anymore, so she decided to let her friend drive her home the next day, fearing that she would blame herself in the future.
Her premonition unfortunately came true, and her father died in the early morning of the February 6. )
(To protect the privacy of interviewees, Fang Hui, Lu Fan and Dong Xue are pseudonyms)

English content:
"The original text of ""The Person who Handed out the Whistle — the Warning of Coronavirus (COVID-19)"" published on renwumag1980, the People Magazine’s WeChat public account, and Weibo on March 10, 2020, was immediately taken off from the entire network. I believe that many people have read this article from the copies saved on websites such as Matters. The COVID incident continues to ferment, and the details further revealed continue to reframe our understanding. Whether questioning or anger, frustration or helplessness, these are all normal responses to our tired nerves. Personally, I left the website after reading this article briefly. Like the protagonist, Dr. Ai Fang, we are all too exhausted. I never thought that this article itself would set off such a large-scale spreading campaign and the whole chilling effect on the Internet on the mainland China. 

“No results” on Weibo Search
In this Internet campaign, of course, many netizens archived backups on platforms outside the wall (such as several reprints in Matters, or archives in Github, etc.), but the most exciting thing was after the article was deleted on March 10th, a large-scale voluntary reposts occurred within the wall (especially on the WeChat platform). The article seemed to simulate a virus, constantly spreading, mutating, and being killed, and being exposed to friends of many netizens, but left with an empty title -  ""The Person who Handed out the Whistle — the Warning of Coronavirus (COVID-19)"".


I do not know whether the purpose of this large number of repeated backups on Matters is to strengthen this impact or to archive the memory on the Internet for themselves.
Here I recorded these various variants here (a total of 22 versions are temporarily included below, and there are more variants of them that have not been found). One can get a glimpse of the humor and talent of netizens.

"
English title: The Reburnished Personal Identity and the Erased Memory on the Internet: "The Person Who Handed out the Whistle — the Warning of Coronavirus (COVID-19)" That Went Viral
原文標題: 被刷新的个人认知和被消失的互联网记忆——《发哨子的人》的病毒式传播

English title: Caixin reporter's notes: the authorities conceal the epidemic situation before the lockdown of Wuhan
原文標題: 财新记者手记再爆武汉封城前当局隐瞒疫情

English content:
Wuhan University Zhongnan Hospital was the only helpful hospital during the 80 days that I did firsthand reporting in Wuhan. I contacted more than ten hospitals in Wuhan, but only Wuhan University Zhongnan Hospital was willing to be interviewed. While many large hospitals did not even let reporters in, Zhongnan Hospital opened its doors to all reporters. I interviewed more than ten people, including the director, doctors, and nurses. They all opened their hearts and told me about the real situation without reservation.
    Zhongnan Hospital was a hospital that possessed valuable human resources. Under the leadership of a group of skilled doctors, Zhongnan Hospital started the wartime mobilization on January 3 in the encounter battle against the virus, and established fever clinics and isolation wards in accordance with the strictest guidelines of SARS prevention. During the attrition war against the virus, they took charge of the seventh designated hospital and the Wuhan Living Room Hospital, the largest Fangcang Shelter Hospital in Wuhan. During the decisive phase of the battle, they were in charge of the Leishenshan Hospital, fighting against the virus with perseverance and professionalism, and they are still staying at Leishenshan Hospital to treat the last dozens of patients. Zhongnan Hospital, which only counts as a medium-sized hospital among all the hospitals in Wuhan, has took on the most work in the fight against the virus, providing 5,400 beds for coronavirus patients at the peak of the epidemic.
    Wang Xinghuan, the director of Zhongnan Hospital, is a bit of a maverick. He is a top urologist in China and has just won the second prize of the State Technological Invention Award in 2019. In Guangzhou, 2003, Wang Xinghuan was on the front line of the fight against SARS. He could never forget about the experience and had since kept his notes detailing the timeline of the epidemic in his computer. On January 10, sensing the severity of the situation, he sent his SARS notes to many provincial and municipal leaders to remind them not to forget the painful lessons of SARS. Unfortunately, things eventually developed in the worst direction he’d expected.
English title: Caixin reporter Xiao Hui’s notes revealed: Before the lockdown of Wuhan, Zhongnan Hospital kept reporting suspected cases to the National Health Commission, and was repeatedly criticized for “not having enough political awareness”!
原文標題: 财新记者萧辉手记流出：封城前，中南医院不停向卫健委上报疑似病例，多次被批评“政治觉悟不高”！

English content:
"The secretary of the Hubei Provincial Party Committee said that ‘Huanggang must not be turned into the second Wuhan' and hopes that other cities will not repeat the tragedy of Wuhan!"
“I go to work!
My protection is absolutely professional, don’t worry!
Write all my words down:  the frontline medical care in Wuhan can persist in working for a while. The ordinary people who are locked at home should not worry about going to work now. Let's persist and get back our happy life. "
This article was firstly issued on Southern People Weekly
Written by | Xu Mei, the reporter of this journal
Edited by | Kuai Lehao, Zhou Jianping
The full article has about 4040 words, and it takes about 10 minutes to read it carefully
Lunch included two dishes and one soup. Sun Ping (pseudonym) made them for herself. She was the first-line medical care of an First-class Hospital at Grade 3 in Wuhan. "To fight this virus, it depends on immunity and we must eat well."
After lunch, she rode an electric scooter to go to work in the hospital. After traffic control, it was her most effective means of transportation.
A shift would last for 7 hours. "I don't drink or eat during shift, and I even don't go to the toilet."
On the one hand, it was very busy, the more important thing was that protective clothing and N95 masks were distributed in limited quantities.
Wearing a mask for a long time, her face was pressed with a deep scar. "The rope is tied to the ear, like a knife."
But this is also a kind of "happiness"- only the medical N95 with extremely strict protection can produce such an effect. "N95 can only be worn by the medical personnel who need to directly contact patients, and only one mask is distributed per day."
The hospital provided a dormitory for the first-line medical care personnel. Sun Ping lived for two days and couldn't stand it. Their hospital is a typical small First-class Hospital at Grade 3, and there are more than 1,000 people in administrative logistics. "Now about 20% personnel in all departments fallen ill. There are several suspended patients in our department."
Living in the dormitory, she didn't dare to take off her mask when she slept. "Because you don't know who might be “infected”, many people are now asymptomatic."
Some colleagues temporarily had no symptoms, but because of the doctor's self-examination, they felt that they had been infected and "feel uneasy", they continuously took lung CT for 3 days in a row, which showed that "it was normal for the first two days, and on the third day, the lungs showed that there was something really wrong.
Is it terror or not? "
Lung CT is a highly accurate test method when there is no condition to take a test for diagnosis.
She lived apart from her family very early, and the girl persuaded her not to go to work again. "Mom, don't go to work!
Aren’t you afraid?
Even if resigning will confiscate your professional qualification certificate, our family has money to live, and soon I can work and support our family. "
Sun Ping cried. "Of course I'm afraid. How can I not be afraid?
People around me fell down successively, I don't know if our small hospital can hold up. "
"I want to tell the real situation that I have seen and known. I don't want to create panic. I don't want to chase anyone's responsibility. I just want ordinary people to know the real situation, and all parts of the country can pay attention to it from top to bottom.".
She also opened all the WeChat friends circle to me. On October 1, the National Day of 2019, the family went out to travel. She smiled brightly in the photo. "Before the epidemic, my life was very happy."
Besides the happy family, she also has a harmonious and friendly department environment. "The atmosphere of our department is one of the best in the hospital."
When seeing Lu Xiaohong with real name, the director of Wuhan Fifth Hospital, telling the media about the personal observation of Wuhan epidemic hiding, she praised her colleague's integrity and courage.
"The secretary of the Hubei Provincial Party Committee said that ‘Huanggang must not be turned into the second Wuhan' and hopes that other cities will not repeat the tragedy of Wuhan!"
Dressed neatly and closed her door, she shouted on WeChat, "I go to work!
My protection is absolutely professional, don’t worry!
Write all my words down: just says that the frontline medical care in Wuhan can persist in working for a while. The ordinary people who are locked at home should not worry about going to work first. Let's persist and get back our happy life. "
Sun Ping’s oral statement:
1. At the end of December and early January, we found that this virus was completely different from before. At that time, we called it "virus lung."
At the end of December, 2019, we saw a "white lung" dynamic CT transmitted from a large comprehensive First-class Hospital at Grade 3, and all the patients' lungs were eroded by viruses.
Ten-second video made people scared.
I asked our hospital's professional lung CT diagnostician, whether this would be a viral cold or other diseases.
"It's completely different, and nothing else will be as full and diffuse as this."
He answered for sure.
At that time, some people thought it was "suspected SARS". Everyone was very sensitive and immediately put on standard protection-masks, hats and gloves.
Around December 30, it was reported at that time that "the unexplained pneumonia in Wuhan has been quarantined and the results will be announced as soon as possible", and we paid special attention to it, waiting for the confirmation notice from the top.
Within a few days, the hospital organized training, and the notice said "viral pneumonia of unknown origin", which was later referred to as "viral lung".
All departments were required to attend, the training materials were kept strictly confidential, and the notice said that those who take photos and rumor have serious consequences should be held accountable.
At the beginning of January, there were suspected patients in various hospitals. Some small hospitals did not accept fever patients and pushed them to other hospitals.
This situation was jointly reported to Wuhan Health Commission by several other hospitals, and the notice was issued from top, saying that the patients admitted to each hospital must be treated by themselves, blocking the opening of referral.
As Director Lu Xiaohong of Wuhan No.5 Hospital said, most hospitals were not infectious disease hospitals and did not have quarantined conditions.
Only the quarantined ward can be vacated urgently, and the respiratory medicine department, emergency department, fever clinic and intensive care unit of our hospital should be integrated to deal with it.
At that time, there was already a feeling of fighting hard. I believed all hospitals were prepared, but there was no announcement or reminder.
According to the regulations on the management of infectious diseases, hospitals did not have the authority to report suspected cases, and they must obey Wuhan Health Commission when releasing them.
At that time, the top asked us that all specimens were not allowed to be sent out. At that time, there was no special "virus lung" nucleic acid test reagent, and we could only rule out one by one whether it was caused by other known viruses. If not, the results, together with the lung CT diagnosis made by the first diagnosis of radiology department, were determined as "virus lung suspected".
2、
2. In mid-January, "patchy infection lesions" became a customary description among doctors, and medical staff were infected, but the hospital had no right to raise the protection level
In mid-January, our all departments had already entered a state of high tension, and at that time, it was heard that some suspected patients in hospitals had died.
The emergency department of every hospital was crowded with people, and the communication between hospitals was not good.
At that time, it was not allowed to write "viral pneumonia" in the medical certificate, but some hospitals wrote "patchy infection lesions". All hospitals were communicated, and many of similar cases were written according to this. If doctors saw that the patients coming to see a doctor with the initial diagnosis opinion of "multiple patchy infection lesions in both lungs" (equivalent to highly suspected), they basically understood what this means and know how to deal with it.
The medical personnel in the fever ward had put on protective clothing conditionally.
However, the protection level of the whole hospital had not been uniformly adjusted, and only when it reached the third level of protection, the medical personnel could be protected from infection to a greater extent.
However, from January 6 to January 10, Wuhan Municipal Health Commission did not issue a circular on "unknown pneumonia".
The notification that we have received from the Health Commission was on January 5: "There were 59 patients diagnosed with viral pneumonia of unknown cause, and no clear evidence of human-to-human infection was found, and no medical personnel were found to be infected."
At that time, no hospital in Wuhan was able to rise the protection level without authorization. During this period, it was also the time when medical personnel were most infected, and several colleagues in our hospital were infected.
The most deplorable thing was that the infection of more than a dozen medical personnel caused by the patient in Concord Neurosurgery.
In fact, during the operation on the night of January 7, doctors told each other to take care of the virus lung. However, at that time, the notification from the Health Commission was "no clear evidence of human-to-human infection", and the patient did not have any respiratory symptoms, so he had to operate according to the hospital's routine operation protection requirements.
At last, this patient became ill. On January 15th, he was diagnosed with COVID-19 infection, and the medical personnel were wronged because there was no "negligence" as mentioned by the outside world, and all the protection that could be done (at that time) had been done to the best.
In the announcement issued by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 16th, there was still no mention of the infection of medical personnel.
Like many medical personnel in other hospitals, I didn't know about this until the January 20. We all said that if Academician Zhong Nanshan hadn't told us about this, the doctors wouldn't know how many people would be dumped.
Even the front-line didn’t know anything, ordinary people didn't know the danger of ambush around them.
On January 18, it was the small Chinese New Year, people in Wuhan still attached great importance to this festival. Friends and family would have dinner together. The subway was full of people, and none of them wore masks.
The unit ordered us not to spread, but in fact, I had been reminding my neighbors to pay attention to this matter in the owners' group of our community. I believed I was definitely not the only one among the medical personnel doing this, but it is too small to rely on personal strength.
We also dare not publish on the Internet, for fear of being labeled as "spreading rumors" and "creating panic".
On January 20, Academician Zhong said in an interview with Bai Yansong that "it is certain that the human-to-human infection", which made people pay more attention to it.
We are in the front line, and we have seen clearly before that this virus is contagious.
There were 3 patients in a ward, and there was no communication with each other. All 3 were viral lungs.
There was also a young man, who is very handsome. He said that the local media reports were so understated that he continued to work after being infected. As a result, he infected everyone in the same office.
I lived separately from my family at that time.
It was the saddest day for me, and I felt oppressed.
As a medical staff, I must obey discipline.
But I didn't know why we can't say anything.

3. Since January 23, after the lockdown of the city, the hospital has been surrounded by swarming patients, and the treatment was under great pressure
After Academician Zhong issued an early warning, many citizens rushed into the hospital and asked for examination.
Have you seen the video of the crowded fever clinic in Wuhan Union Hospital on January 23?
Although 7 new hospitals were added to treat fever patients in an emergency on the January 22, and then 2 batches were added in succession, hoping to achieve special treatment for diseases, the epidemic spread because of the loss of control in the early stage, and the idea of special treatment could not be realized at all.
From January 23, when the city was locked down, to January 26, when the traffic control started at 0: 00, there were at least 5 or 6 hundred people doing CT every day in our hospital, and there was no way to maintain the scene order.
There are a little fewer people in the past 2 days, and there were almost 200 suspected cases in one day. Our whole hospital has only 200 beds in quarantine ward, and now the general departments are basically closed, and we are fully dealing with fever.
Do you think this situation is urgent or not?
Other hospitals were similar, so you only needed to see how difficult it is to be hospitalized.
All relatives and friends were asking for help, but if you want to be hospitalized at this time, to be honest, even the hospital leadership couldn’t solve the problem.
I have been doctor for so many years, and my heart has not hardened.
Yesterday, I saw the old couple, whose children were not around, and came to the hospital trembling. The filming situation was very bad, but there was no bed, so they had to go home.
How could we do?
I didn't know, I could only tell them how to quarantine when they go back home.
What a pity, this disease was a great test for the old and weak.
I didn't want to cause panic, but we must let everyone know that this virus is not as deadly as SARS, and the progress of clinical treatment is not so fast, but the infection speed is only strong or weak.
You may not get sick, but you may also be a very poisonous source of infection.
Between hospitals and peers, they have a meeting to study together, or a professional, and there are large groups across hospitals. I heard that there is a large group of radiology departments in the whole province. In recent more than a month, no one dared to speak, probably not knowing what to say.
Radiology Department is so critical.
After the media propaganda, the common people recognized the diagnosis by nucleic acid reagent test. In fact, as everyone knows in hospitals, lung CT is very telling. As long as lung film shows "highly suspected", the proportion of diagnosis by nucleic acid test is very high.
The medical personnel in our hospital also took X-ray. If they were suspected, they would start treatment directly, quarantine early, treat early and recover early. The front line was short of manpower. It was too slow to appoint testing institutions and queue up for nucleic acid testing. The time of front-line medical personnel couldn't afford to delay.
In the past two days, the voices of front-line doctors and nurses came out one after another, and there were more reports on TV, and various business groups were a little active.
The protection level of our hospital has been upgraded to three levels, so people must be fully informed of the spread, risk and pathogenicity of the epidemic.
These were the whole process from discovery to spread of the epidemic as I know it. Of course, they were only observations in a small area where I live, but I think it can also explain many problems.
I don't complain to anyone, I don't want to blame anyone, and I don't want people to panic.
Now the country attaches great importance to it, and all parties give full support to it, so we must persist in carrying it down no matter how difficult it is in the front line.
I don't know if I can bear it all the time. I hope people in other cities don't pay such a high price like Wuhan.
(In order to protect the privacy of respondents, Sun Ping is assumed as an alias.
Here, I would also like to thank all the front-line doctors and nurses who have been interviewed by this journal and delivered the truth to readers. )

English content:
"Many of the doctors and nurses I’m familiar with have had the idea of resigning and switching careers after the epidemic is over." Liu Jie, a doctor from Wuhan Central Hospital, told the Global Times’ correspondent in Wuhan, "This epidemic has overturned the value and perception on life and career of many of us. Colleagues that passed away, and helpless patients. We kept the zeal of being a doctor, but have been drenched by reality again and again. For healthcare providers, it seems that there is nothing more desperate than this." 

"But we ultimately stand still until now. We have experienced the warm and cold of the world, witnessed the revival of the city. There is some kind of enthusiasm that only when you go through the darkness and finally see the silver lining can you resonate with it deeply." Liu Jie said. 

The existing published academic papers show that the first confirmed case of COVID-19 in Wuhan occurred on December 1 last year.

English content:
Reporter from the Paper: Hu Danping, Tang Qi, Luo Zihan; Intership: Liu Yuxiu
Wu Juan, who lives in Qingshan District of Wuhan City, never expected father to get a positive result of nucleic acid test.
Since the symptoms such as fatigue and cough appeared on January 26, Wu Juan's father has been waiting for a confirmed diagnosis - if COVID-19 pneumonia (hereinafter referred to as "COVID-19") was not diagnosed, he would not be admitted to hospital.
Because of repeated fever, Wu Juan's father has been weak and unable to stand.
The problem faced by Wu Juan's family was not a single case. The virus nucleic acid test, which has always been the "gold standard" for diagnosis in COVID-19, has a false negative situation in practice.
Xu Shunqing, deputy dean of the School of Public Health, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, said at a press conference in Hubei Province on the evening of February 9 that COVID-19 mainly invaded the lungs, so there was a certain false negative in nucleic acid test, namely, some patients were not detected, that is, missed diagnosis, which may cause some infection sources not really identified, and there was a risk of expansion.
But at the same time, it is very important for the epidemic which is still in the high incidence period to screen out the confirmed patients in the shortest time and then treat them centrally.
At present, nucleic acid test still plays a very important role in the process of diagnosis.
Li Taisheng, director of the Department of Infectious Diseases, Peking Union Medical College Hospital, who participated in the prevention and control of SARS in 2003, said in an interview with The Paper that COVID-19 could be diagnosed as soon as possible through nucleic acid test, which was a more favorable condition compared with the prevention and control in 2003.
At the same time, with the adjustment of the national diagnosis and treatment scheme and the attention of many medical experts, the loopholes brought by false negatives in nucleic acid test are shrinking.
"After this problem was discovered, the National Health Commission tried the 5th edition of COVID-19's diagnosis and treatment plan and began to use CT and clinic as the basis. Now the judgment of the condition is not only the emergence of positive nucleic acid test, but also the clinical standard. There is no fever for 3 consecutive days. CT imaging has improved, and these 3 aspects are combined."
Xu Shunqing said on the evening of February 9.
At noon on the February 11, Wu Juan told The Paper, and father had already been admitted to the centralized isolation point in Qingshan District of Wuhan on the February 10.
They were still waiting for the results of father's second nucleic acid test.
Because of the limited medical conditions at the isolation point, father still had to go to Wuhan No.9 Hospital for injections every day after living in the isolation point.
A "door" that must be passed for diagnosis
Wu Juan didn't realize the seriousness of the epidemic until Wuhan’s “lockdown”.
But she never imagined that the haze of the epidemic would come to her family.
On January 26, the 2nd day of the lunar month, Wu Juan's father started to have symptoms such as soreness in the waist, fatigue and cough.
At this time, only 3 days have passed since Wuhan’s "lockedown".
In order to help father buy anti-inflammatory drugs, Wu Juan went to pharmacies near home, but she couldn't buy them, and even Oseltamivir for treating influenza was sold out.
In desperation, she had to buy 10 boxes of kid Oseltamivir for her 71-year-old father.
At this time, father was still very stubborn.
He always thought that his symptoms were caused by falling asleep when he opened the window to breathe.
Until February 3, father didn't take any medicine, and his physical discomfort became more and more serious.
On the morning of February 4, father was too tired to get up, his face turned red, and his body temperature was measured to be 37.4°C. After going to a community outpatient clinic in Qingshan District for routine blood test, it was found that the ratio of white blood cells and lymphocytes was low, accompanied by fever, so the community hospital suggested that he be sent to CR & WISCO General Hospital for CT examination.
On the same day, the CT diagnosis result was infectious disease of both lungs. The doctor thought it was viral pneumonia and prescribed Oseltamivir and Lianhua Qingwen Granule. He was advised to go home and observe in isolation. If the fever was above 38.5°C, he would go to the hospital again.
Despite the diagnosis results of CT examination, according to the "Diagnosis and Treatment Scheme for Pneumonia Infected with COVID-19 (Trial Fourth Edition)" issued by the National Health Commission at that time, the confirmed cases should have "real-time fluorescent RT-PCR detection of COIVD-19 nucleic acid positive in respiratory tract samples or blood samples". Simply speaking, the nucleic acid test results are positive.
This has become a "gate” that Wu Juan's father must open for whether to be diagnosed.
Doubt of "False Negative"
On the evening of February 4, Wu Juan's father had a high fever of 39°C.
Wu Juan hurriedly sent his father to CR & WISCO General Hospital for medical treatment. Although the hospital was not a designated hospital, it was relatively close to home.
The doctor prescribed medicine for 10 days, and he could only give infusion in outpatient clinic.
Fortunately, in the evening, the doctor told me that he could come to the hospital for nucleic acid test early the next morning, and Wu Juan felt that there would be hope again.
However, the next day, when they arrived at CR & WISCO General Hospital on time, the fever clinic doctor said that there were only 20 nucleic acid test reagents on that day, and there was no name of Wu Juan's father on the registration list. The reagents on that day had been used up, so they had to wait another day before going to the hospital for detection.
Because of repeated fever, Wu Juan's father was unable to stand, so he had to squat down in the corridor of the hospital to rest.
Wu Juan said that on the same day, a leader went to CR & WISCO General Hospital to inspect the epidemic prevention and control work. When watching her father crouching in the hospital corridor, the leader went forward to know the situation, and then arranged for the elderly to take the "green channel", finally achieving the key step of diagnosis - nucleic acid test.
Only when the nucleic acid test is positive her father would be confirmed, and it is possible and qualified for her father to be hospitalized.
“But, what if it’s not positive?”
Wu Juan is still worried about that.
In fact, her worries have reason.
The problem of false negative test of COVID-19 virus nucleic acid has surfaced one after another.
On the evening of February 5, Wang Chen, vice president of Chinese Academy of Engineering and president of Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, told CCTV “News 1+1” that not all patients could detect nucleic acid positive, but only 30% to 50% of patients with COVID-19 infection were positive.
There are still many false negatives by collecting throat swabs of suspected cases.
On the evening of February 6, Li Wenliang of Central Hospital of Wuhan Eye Hospital, which attracted the attention of the whole network, was critically ill and died after several hours of rescue.
According to the Weibo released by Li Wenliang before his death, he was officially diagnosed after 3 nucleic acid tests, and the results of the first 2 nucleic acid tests were negative.
At noon on February 7, the results of Wu Juan's father's first nucleic acid test were released, which showed negative.
But at this time, father still had a high fever, and his consciousness was somewhat blurred.
In the afternoon, her father went to CR & WISCO General Hospital again for blood routine examination and CT examination. The CT imaging diagnosis was more serious than the first one.
The doctor suggested that Wu Juan's father go to No.9 Hospital for reexamination, because CR & WISCO General Hospital was not a designated hospital, so COVID-19 could not be judged as false negative, and gave her a notice of transfer.
On the morning of February 8, Wu Juan's father went to Wuhan No.9 Hospital and showed the doctor the test results before, but he had to wait for transfusion in the outpatient department first.
The community was still making efforts.
On the morning of February 9, after receiving the telephone notification from the community workers, Wu Juan took her father to the No.9 Hospital for the second nucleic acid test, and the results could be obtained in about 2 to 3 days.
She said that she even expected her father's nucleic acid test to be positive, so that she could be hospitalized as soon as possible.
Zhou Xin, head of the first expert group supporting Hubei Medical Team from Shanghai, also said in an interview with The Paper that false negatives also involve many aspects, including differences in respiratory sensitivity of different people, differences in sampling methods and differences in production of different kit companies, which may cause false negatives for various reasons.
The "supplementary plan" is coming
The appearance of false negative in nucleic acid test also made fine-tuning the diagnosis and treatment scheme for COVID-19.
After the outbreak, the National Plan for “Diagnosis and Treatment of Pneumonia Infected with COVID-19” was continuously updated, and the 5th edition was released by February 5.
In case diagnosis, this version of the diagnosis and treatment plan treats Hubei Province differently from other provinces except Hubei Province.
Other provinces outside Hubei Province are still divided into "suspected cases" and "confirmed cases".
However, Hubei Province added with the classification of "clinical diagnosis".
The standard of "suspected case" has modified to be considered as a suspected case, regardless of epidemiological history, as long as it meets the 2 clinical manifestations of "fever and/or respiratory symptoms" and "normal or decreased white blood cell count or decreased lymphocyte count in early onset".
It’s equivalent to the standard of suspected cases has been relaxed.
Suspected cases with imaging features of pneumonia are clinically diagnosed cases.
The diagnostic criteria for confirmed cases have not changed.
The problem of missed diagnosis caused by false negative nucleic acid test is also attracting the attention of experts.
On the evening of February 9, at the press conference held in Hubei, Xu Shunqing, deputy dean of School of Public Health, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, said that the part invaded by COVID-19 was mainly the lungs, so there was a certain false negative in nucleic acid test, that is, some patients were not detected, which was missed diagnosis, which may cause some infection sources not really identified, and there was a risk of expansion.
Xu Shunqing believed that after this problem was discovered, the 5th edition of the trial diagnosis and treatment plan took clinical symptoms such as CT detection as the basis. Now, the judgment of the disease was not only the appearance of nucleic acid test, but also clinical standards. There was no fever for 3 consecutive days, and CT imaging has improved. These three aspects were combined.
Li Qing, a local person in Wuhan, is the beneficiary of the 5th edition of the diagnosis and treatment plan.
On February 3, Li Qing's parents-in-law and grandmother went to the Tongji Hospital affiliated to Huazhong University of Science and Technology for nucleic acid testing. The results showed that the mother-in-law and grandmother were positive for nucleic acid, and they were hospitalized after being diagnosed with COVID-19.
However, the results of CT showed that the father-in-law had the most serious lung infection among the 3, and it spread, but the results of nucleic acid test were negative, so the doctor asked him to queue up again for nucleic acid test.
Li Qing told The Paper that her father-in-law got the opportunity of hospitalization on February 7, judging by the clinical diagnosis standard because of the serious infection symptoms.
For patients with COVID-19 in Hubei Province, if there are no serious symptoms, in order to reduce the risk of infection, the 5th edition of the trial diagnosis and treatment plan requires the medical personnel at all levels and all kinds of medical institutions to find suspected diseases and clinical diagnosis cases that meet the case definition, and then carry out isolation treatment immediately.
Suspected cases and clinically diagnosed cases should be isolated in a single room, and specimens should be collected for pathogen detection as soon as possible.
Discharge standards are no longer single
Liu Tong’s 70-year-old mother from Wuhan, was admitted to the isolation ward because the results of 2 nucleic acid tests were negative and could not be diagnosed, but she had certain symptoms of pulmonary infection.
His mother fell ill on January 23.
After becoming a suspected case, Liu Tong's mother was isolated in the ward of Wuhan No.8 Hospital.
From January 26 to now, she has finished 2 nucleic acid tests, and the hospital has not informed him of the results.
However, the announcement of the hospital showed that it was negative if it was not notified within 48 hours, so he acquiesced that his mother's result was also negative.
Liu Tong's mother's previous CT examination showed double lung infection.
What worries him more was that, because she was not a confirmed patient, his mother lives in a six-person room instead of a single-room isolation ward, which was filled with people like his mother who cannot be diagnosed.
Liu Tong was worried about whether there will be cross infection if there is false negative.
Fortunately, his mother's current physical condition tended to be stable, but the epidemic situation was still at a high incidence. Liu Tong cannot confirm whether mother can be discharged from hospital, and whether she is not a COVID-19 patient or contagious.
"I can only stay for a few more days."
He said.
For patients who have recovered from hospital, nucleic acid test was also a necessary procedure.
The trouble of false negative also exists.
In the trial of the 4th edition and the previous "Diagnosis and Treatment Plan for Pneumonia Infected with COVID-19", the criteria for releasing isolation and discharge of patients with COVID-19 are that their body temperature has returned to normal for more than 3 days, their respiratory symptoms have obviously improved, and they have been tested negative for respiratory pathogen nucleic acid twice in a row (the sampling interval is at least 1 day), so they can be released from isolation and discharged or transferred to corresponding departments for treatment of other diseases according to their illness.
If 2 consecutive nucleic acid tests for infected people are false negative, it will affect the judgment of recovered patients.
The corresponding supplement appeared in the 5th edition of "Diagnosis and Treatment Scheme of Pneumonia Infected with COVID-19".
The requirements of discharge standard are increased, and it is necessary to judge whether discharge is possible from 3 aspects: nucleic acid test, clinical symptoms and lung imaging.
Zhou Xin told The Paper that, generally speaking, patients who meet the nucleic acid test and are negative twice can be discharged safely.
It will be more scientific and safe to go home and quarantine for two weeks after discharge.
"To reduce false negatives, sampling should be accurate and the sampling method should be correct."
Zhou Xin said that the medical personnel for sampling should receive standardized training.
The sputum coughed by patients can be sampled, and the lavage fluid can also be used for nucleic acid detection. If the samples of deep respiratory tract can be obtained, its sensitivity and specificity are very high.
For most patients, it can be detected accurately.

Li Taisheng, director of the Department of Infectious Diseases, Peking Union Medical College Hospital, who participated in the prevention and control of SARS in 2003, said in an interview with The Paper that COVID-19 could be diagnosed as soon as possible through nucleic acid test, which was a more favorable condition compared with the prevention and control in 2003.
Wu Juan told The Paper that, on the morning of February 10, father was admitted to the centralized isolation point in Qingshan District, Wuhan.
They were still waiting for the results of father's second nucleic acid test.
(Wu Juan, Li Qing and Liu Tong are pseudonyms, and intern Yan Caiqi also contributed to this article. )
This journal edited by Chang Chen
