English content:
Produced by|Netease Qingliu Studio
Writer|Liu Pei         Chief Editor|Zhao Yan
The weather in Wuhan has been cold for several days in recent days. Merchant with surname of Wang who once sold aquatic products in the Seafood Wholesale Market at No.207 Development Avenue, Jianghan District, Wuhan said: "Every time we go out and come back, we must disinfect our clothes with alcohol."
South China Seafood Wholesale Market, was proved as the source of COVID-19.
On January 1, 2020, after the South China Seafood Wholesale Market was completely closed, the expert group conducted virus traceability research.
After the market was closed, the above-mentioned merchant with surname of Wang, who still had hope of reopening the market, did not wait for the official survey results.
Around January 8, seeing that the situation is getting more and more urgent, she gave the workers the holiday to go home in advance.
Until January 26, the official side announced the research progress.
According to the China CDC, the expert group quarantined COVID-19 from South China Seafood Wholesale Market, proving that the virus originated from wild animals sold in South China Seafood Wholesale Market.
At present, the COVID-19, which started from South China Seafood Wholesale Market, has spread rapidly through the chain of wild animals infecting to human and human infecting to others.
By the time of being published, there have been more than 2,700 confirmed cases and more than 5,000 suspected cases.
The wild taste on the tip of the tongue has become a frightening "poison", and the largest seafood wholesale market in South China and its boss behind the scenes have aroused media attention for a while.
South China Seafood Wholesale Market belongs to Wuhan South China Real Estate Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "South China Group"), a local enterprise in Wuhan, and is controlled by Yu's family.
At present, shareholders Yu Tian and Yu Qize each hold 50% of shares, and they are siblings.
According to Netease Qingliu Studio, South China Group was founded by Yu Zhusheng (Yu Tian's father). At present, Yu Zhusheng has been about 60 years old and basically in retirement. The specific business of Yu’s family has been handed over to professional managers, and Yu’s family mainly focus on personnel and finance, of which Yu Tian is mainly responsible for finance.
South China Group made its fortune mainly by purchasing land around Wuhan and Hubei rural areas, and then dabbled in warehousing and farmers' markets.
Among them, South China Seafood Wholesale Market was developed, constructed and operated by South China Group in 2011. It was once accused by public opinion of violent demolition and the use of triad forces because of the demolition of the project.
Chen Zhixiang, a key figure, always accompanied the expansion of the wealth map of Yu’s family , and the 2 parities also cooperated to open a pawn company to engage in usury business.
Chen Zhixiang has many connections with Wuhan state-owned assets system. Yu's family can also find contact with people in Hubei state-owned assets system.
Fame rises: real estate projects are accused of "violent demolitions"
South China Group first started from Yu Zhusheng's contract team.
According to China Business Journal, Yu Zhusheng was born in the village of Wuhan in 1962. He did not graduate from primary school and had a low education level.
He has 1 son and 1 daughter with his ex-wife, namely Yu Tian and Yu Qize.
A person who had worked with Yu Zhusheng earlier told Netease Qingliu Studio that Yu Zhusheng started early and started to work step by step as a construction team.
As early as 2008, most of the real estate projects he started to engage in were cooperative development with various township governments, buying lands in some remote places, relying on low-cost cooperative development and construction, earning differential returns and making a fortune.
Industrial and commercial information also supports the above-mentioned person's statement.
In 1990s, Yu Zhusheng was mainly engaged in pile foundation and earthwork construction and concrete supply, etc., and successively established Wuhan South China Pile Machinery Co., Ltd. and Wuhan South China Concrete Supply Center.
According to publicly available materials, Yu Zhusheng began to contact real estate development in 2000.
In 2017, the average selling price of the real estate "Huawei Commercial and Residential Building" developed in that year was RMB 10,000/square meter, and the surrounding real estate was around RMB 30,000/square meter.
the turning point of Yu Zhusheng's real estate business appeared around 2006.
He developed 2 projects that were widely known to Wuhan people - one is the South China Seafood Wholesale Market, which is the source of pneumonia epidemic, and the other is the South China International Plaza, which is a high-end real estate under the South China Group; Both plots are reconstruction projects of Tangjiadun Village in Jianghan District, Wuhan.
In 2006, Yu Zhusheng chose this land.
According to the announcement of a land agreement transfer plan published by Wuhan Natural Resources and Planning Bureau in 2006, 24,000 square meters of land located in Tangjiadun Village, Tangjiadun Street was transferred to Yu Zhusheng's Wuhan Huawei Property Development Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Huawei Property") at a price of RMB 100 million after Land Resource Bureau researching.
South China Seafood Wholesale Market emerged from the ground and is positioned as the largest seafood market in Central China, with a construction area of 50,000 square meters and accommodating thousands of shops.
It is worth noting that the Tangjiadun "Village in City" reconstruction project involves demolition, which once attracted much attention because of "violent demolition".
The demolition party exposed in the public information includes Wuhan Huawei Property Development Co., Ltd. (responsible person Yu Zhusheng, hereinafter referred to as "Huawei Property").
Some villagers in Tangjiadun once clashed with the demolition party for the low compensation fee for demolition, and even suffered bloody casualties.
Some villagers initiated an administrative lawsuit against Jianghan District People's Government in 2012 because the local government did not make it public according to the procedures.

In the first-instance judgment ((2014) EJAXCZ No.00008) published by Jiang 'an District People's Court of Wuhan City in 2014, the court ruled that Jianghan District Government should give a reply within days to the villagers' request to disclose the specific payment and use of land acquisition compensation subsidies for the "Village in City" reconstruction project.
By intervening in the Tangjiadun Village Reconstruction Project, Yu Zhusheng and his South China Group were able to enter the vision of Wuhan public.
But the outside world is still curious, why did the little-known small developer get the Tangjiadun project plot in 2006?
By contrast, the developers of other projects in Tangjiadun are all developed by “Wuhan Joint Venture Vanke Real Estate Co., Ltd.”, which is a cooperation between Wuhan State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission and Vanke.
What is more noteworthy is that it is at the key turning point of Tangjiadun Project that a mysterious businessman began to surface.
In the public information of that year, one of the demolition parties was Huawei Property, and there were also Wuhan Sun Property Development Co., Ltd. and Wuhan Zeshenghe Real Estate Development Co., Ltd..
The chairman of both companies is Chen Zhixiang.
In the social relations of Yu family, this person is a key figure.
Key person and Wuhan state-owned assets
From the industrial and commercial information, Chen Zhixiang cooperated closely with the Yu family.
Netease Qingliu Studio combed down the corporate map behind Yu's family, and found that Chen Zhixiang and his close relative Xiong Qiang appeared in the ownership structure of many companies.
As early as 2009, Chen Zhixiang controlled Wuhan Sun Property Development Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Sun Property") and Yu Zhusheng's South China Seafood Market Co., Ltd. established a pawn company-Wuhan Fusheng Pawn Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Fusheng Pawn"), which involved many large-scale usurious loan in disguise.
According to several judgments inquired by Netease Qingliu Studio, Fusheng Pawnshop has granted millions or even tens of millions of loans to many natural persons, which were actually private loans, and the lending rates all exceed the upper limit of “the Supreme People's Court's Provisions on Several Issues Concerning the Application of Laws in the Trial of Private Lending Cases” (hereinafter referred to as the "Supreme Court Lending Regulations"), and they are judged as usury by the court, and those exceeding the interest rates are not supported.
Xiong Qiang, a close business person of Chen Zhixiang, served as assistant to the general manager of Wuhan Vanke Real Estate Co., Ltd. from 2001 to 2014, and then left Vanke to work as an executive in a company controlled by Chen Zhixiang.
In 2014, he joined as the chairman of Wuhan Kaisheng Economic and Trade Development Co., Ltd. controlled by Chen Zhixiang, and since August 2016, he has served as the chairman of Dalian Friendship (000679.SH) controlled by Chen Zhixiang.
Chen Zhixiang, Yu Tian (daughter of Yu Zhusheng) and Xiong Qiang also took shares in Wuhan Shengshi Tianlai Culture Communication Partnership (Limited Partnership), holding 32.5%, 25% and 2.5% respectively.
In association with Chen Zhixiang, Xiong Qiang and others, the Yu family began to aim real estate projects from Wuhan to the outside of the province in the later period.
In March 2017, Yu Tian and Xiong Qiang invested 1:1 to establish Wuhan Zhujiu Economic and Trade Development Co., Ltd., and the latter obtained 50% equity of Shaanxi Wancheng Investment Development Co., Ltd. through agreement transfer.
In the same year, Yu Tian and Xiong Qiang invested 1:1 to establish Wuhan Hezhu Economic and Trade Development Co., Ltd., and the latter established Xi 'an Zehe Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. together with Xi 'an Vanke Real Estate Development Co., Ltd., in which Xi 'an Vanke was the controlling shareholder with 70% shares and Wuhan Zhujiu held 30% shares.
However, the outside world still didn't know who this "Chen Zhixiang" is.
According to casual information, Chen Zhixiang is from Jianghan District, Wuhan, and is the executive director of Wuhan Sun Property Development Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Sun Property"), and Sun Property is held by Chen Zhixiang and his mother Yang Cuixiang.
Chen Zhixiang’s development properties were only in Wuhan area.
This is the information disclosed by the company when Chen Zhixiang entered Dalian Friendship (000679.SH) in 2016.
According to the disclosure announcement in July of that year, Wuxin Investment Holdings (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Wuxin Shenzhen") received 28% of the original controlling shareholder of Dalian Friendship with 1.3 billion cash and became the controlling shareholder of Dalian Friendship.
The actual controller of Dalian Friendship was changed to Chen Zhixiang.
What is worth paying attention to is that Chen Zhixiang entered Dalian Friendship, in fact, he joined hands with Wuhan SASAC.
According to the announcement, Wuxin Shenzhen, the transferee of Dalian Friendship Control, has its corporate shareholders including Wuhan Kaisheng Economic and Trade Development Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Kaisheng Economic and Trade"), Wuhan Hengsheng Jiaye Economic and Trade Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Hengsheng Jiaye") and Wuhan Credit Investment Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Wuxin Investment Group"), with the shareholding ratio of the three parties being 38%, 22% and 40%.
Dalian Friendship disclosed that Kaisheng Economic & Trade and Hengsheng Jiaye are both enterprises controlled by natural person Chen Zhixiang, and Wuxin Investment Group is a credit guarantee enterprise under Wuhan SASAC.
This means that Chen Zhixiang and Wuhan SASAC have a substantial shareholding ratio of 60% and 40% in Wuxin Shenzhen.
Dalian Friendship said that there is no relationship between Chen Zhixiang and Wuxin Investment Group, and there is no concerted action arrangement.
However, one detail is that among the members of Dalian Friendship Board of Directors after Chen Zhixiang took office, 2 new directors, besides Xiong Qiang representing Chen Zhixiang, the other is Li Jian, who is a member of Wuhan State-owned Assets System, and 2 new members of the Board of Supervisors, including Chairman Gao Zhichao and Supervisor Fan Sining, are all members of Wuhan SASAC System.
That is to say, in the listed companies actually controlled by Chen Zhixiang, Wuhan State-owned Assets System is actually stronger than Chen Zhixiang in the seats of directors and supervisors.
On January 8, 2020, the company announced that its controlling shareholder Wuxin Shenzhen had signed a share transfer agreement with Wuhan Development and Investment Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Wuhan Kaitou") after Dalian Friendship was deeply mired in litigation disputes over overdue debts and equity transfer of its subsidiaries.
After the transfer is completed, the actual controller of Dalian Friendship will be changed from Chen Zhixiang, which is controlled by Wuxin Investment, to Wuhan SASAC, the actual controller of Wuhan Kaitou.
The public records show that the "cooperation" between Chen Zhixiang and Wuhan SASAC is not limited to Dalian Friendship.
Wuxin Investment also appeared in the equity battle of another listed company, New Huangpu (600638.SH).
In June, 2017, Wuxin Investment acquired 32.75% of the rights and interests of the new Huangpu by purchasing trust.
When China Times reported the above-mentioned equity competition of New Huangpu, it quoted people familiar with the matter as saying that the sources of funds of Wuxin Shenzhen and Wuxin Investment Group were probably related to Wuhan Financial Holding. When the reporter asked whether Wuxin Shenzhen belonged to Wuhan Financial Holding Group (referred to as Wuhan Finacial Holding for short), the insider blurted out that it was, but when asked in detail, he faltered.
In addition, Wuhan Changsheng Industrial Co., Ltd. was established in cooperation between Chen Zhixiang and the holding enterprises of Wuhan SASAC, in which Sun Property of Chen Zhixiang holds 49% of the shares, and the shareholders of the other two companies are holding enterprises of Wuhan SASAC.
According to the data collected, the company is mainly engaged in real estate development business, and has successively developed projects such as Sunshine Mansion, Tianli Garden, Dingxiu Crystal City, Ink Qinghua and Dingxiu Palaza.
The Yu's family can also find a connection with the state-owned assets system.
Yu Zhusheng, who is engaged in real estate-related business, registered as an advertising company "Wuhan Shenghua Advertising Co., Ltd." in January 2003.
Another natural person shareholder of the company is Wang Houfang.
According to the related information of Qixinbao, Wang Houfang was the legal representative and chairman of Hubei Hongtai Cultural Travel Industry Investment Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Hongtai Cultural Travel") and Hubei Hongtai Baibuting Investment Management Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Hongtai Baibuting Investment"). 
Among them, Hongtai Cultural Travel is a wholly-owned company of Hubei SASAC after penetration, and Hongtai Baibuting Investment is a holding company of Hubei SASAC after penetration.
Liu Pei is a senior author of Qingliu Studio, based in Beijing.
Produced by Netease Qingliu Studio (WeChat: wangyiqingliu), it is forbidden to reprint without authorization.

English content:
At present, at least two doctors are also infected with the coronavirus and are hospitalized in Wuhan Pulmonary Hospital; one of them is the co-chairman of the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery, and the other is the co-chairman of the Department of Urology in Wuhan Central Hospital.
“They are all on ECMO and in critical conditions,” a head nurse of the hospital told Caixin reporters.
    According to data collected by Caixin reporters, Wuhan Central Hospital, which has more than 4,000 employees, has already counted more than 230 coronavirus cases. Although the number of infections in Wuhan Central Hospital is still lower than that of other major hospitals, their proportion of medical staff infections and death tolls are the highest among all the hospitals in Wuhan.
    “We still have very little understanding of the pathogenic mechanism of the coronavirus, and we do not have a scientific explanation as to why so many skilled doctors in Central Hospital died of the virus, but at least we know the reason that so many medical staff have been infected is because our hospital has been at the forefront of the epidemic in the very beginning, and it is also related to the so-called policy of “being internally strict and outwardly relaxed” before January 20, which led to a large number of in-hospital infections,” said one co-chairman of the hospital to Caixin reporters. “Misinformation was circulating in the hospital, and led hundreds of doctors and nurses to believe that the virus couldn’t be transmitted by direct person-to-person contact and was preventable and controllable.  As a result, they worked hard to treat patients while without correct knowledge of the epidemic, and even after they fell ill, they couldn't report it to the government. Their sacrifices failed to serve as a warning to their colleagues and the public in time; this is the most painful loss and lesson.”
English title: Why did Li Wenliang's hospital have so many casualties?

English content:
The full article has about 5222 words, and it takes about 12 minutes to read it.
Southern Weekend reporters interviewed more than 20 hospital contacts who issued announcements.
To sum up, there are 3 types of reasons for hospitals to ask for donations. One is that there is really no material; One is to plan ahead; There is another type, which is that materials were sent to Wuhan.
A hospital staff who participated in fund-raising explained that the reason for choosing fund-raising instead of purchasing was that the hospital procurement process is complicated, and it is difficult to complete the process in a short time, while fund-raising is much more direct.
Among 11 kinds of emergency materials and equipment in the “Catalog of Health Emergency Materials Reserve in Guizhou Province”, there were only 5 kinds and 2 kinds that have reached 100% in the city and county level disease control institutions respectively; there were only 22.2% of city and state-level disease control institutions have complete management records (including lists, warehousing registration, etc.), and only 18.5% of county-level disease control institutions.
In December 2019, a piece of essay written by the staff of Hubei CDC showed that the physical value of all reserves of hospitals in Hubei Province in 2016 was RMB 670,100.
According to the report of the National Development and Reform Commission, since "9.11" and "anthrax", the US medical reserve budget has increased from US$ 50 million to US$ 600 million (about RMB 4.2 billion).
This article was first published in the Southern Weekend and cannot be reproduced without authorization
Writtent by | Southern Weekly Reporters: Wang Weikai, Zhou Xiaoling and Jin Yibu
Souther Weekend Intern: Gong Roushan
Managing Editor |  Zhang Yue
By the morning of January 28, 2020, 74 medical organizations outside Hubei Province had appealed for help, including many well-known hospitals.
Since the outbreak of COVID-19, the shortage of medical materials has become the biggest problem in hospitals.
Initially, hospitals in Wuhan began to face the public, announce the contact information of their employees and seek social donations.
Then, the number of hospitals in Hubei Province increased to nearly 90.
Then, this “Helping” wave of hospitals spread all over the country.
According to the statistics of Southern Weekend reporters, by the morning of January 28, there were as many as 71 hospitals that issued help information outside Hubei Province, in order of quantity: Sichuan Province (17), Guangdong Province (11), Anhui Province (10), Zhejiang Province (9), Hainan Province (4), Beijing (3), Gansu Province (3), Shaanxi Province (3), the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region (2), Shandong Province (2), Henan Province (1), Hunan Province (2), Shanxi Province (1), Shanghai (1), Jiangxi Province (1) and Jiangsu Province (1).
It covered county-level, municipal-level, provincial-level hospitals and even national famous hospitals.
In addition, there were 3 non-hospital institutions asking for help: Cangnan County Health Bureau in Zhejiang Province, Xianju County Prevention and Control Headquarters, and Longgang City Leading Group for Joint Prevention and Control of Pneumonia Epidemic.
After SARS in 2003, China experienced many large-scale infectious diseases, such as Streptococcus Suis infection in Sichuan in 2005, Influenza A (H1N1) in 2009, H7N9 avian influenza infection in 2013, and import of Middle East respiratory syndrome in 2015.
After several epidemic situations, why is there still such a general shortage of medical supplies?
1. The procurement process is complicated, donation is more direct.
On January 26, Gan County People's Hospital of Xianyang City, Shaanxi Province released a message of accepting donations, and urgently needed N95 masks, protective clothing and impact goggles.
This county-level people's hospital is the only designated hospital for treating pneumonia patients with COVID-19. At present, there has been a shortage of protective equipment.
The hospital staff told Southern Weekend reporters that they had almost no masks and goggles. On January 25, in order to test patients, they borrowed a set of masks from Xianyang Central Hospital.
“We want to buy, but we cannot.
Donating money is useless, what we need is material.”
He told Southern Weekend reporter that there have been one confirmed case in Gan County, and if more suspected patients came to check, the crisis of material shortage would become more prominent.
On the same day, the Central Hospital of Zhumadian, Henan Province also issued an announcement of emergency procurement and donation acceptance. The contact person of the hospital also told Southern Weekend reporters that they are not short of money, but lack of materials.
Not only county and municipal hospitals were short of materials, but also provincial hospitals and even well-known hospitals in China.
On January 25, Hainan Provincial People's Hospital issued an announcement asking all sectors of society to donate protective materials.
The staff of the hospital office told Southern Weekend reporter that there were no fewer than 120 medical personnel in the hospital at present, and the quarantine consumables needed to be replaced regularly.
Only for protective clothings, they needed 200 sets every day to meet the demand.
Due to the shortage of disposable protective consumables, front-line medical personnel can only reduce the frequency of going to the toilet or choose to wear adult diapers.
The China-Japan Friendship Hospital directly under the National Health Commission of People’s Republic of China also issued a fund-raising announcement on the same day.
But after one day, the announcement has been deleted on the website of the hospital.
"Don't allow us to make announcements, we still welcome to raise materials privately."
A Beijing hospital staff who also issued an announcement revealed to the Southern Weekend reporter that "the announcement was withdrawn to prevent panic. It seems that the hospital has treated many patients, but it is not. It is just a preparation. I am afraid that new patients will come with insufficient materials and cannot be admitted."
A hospital staff who participated in fund-raising explained that the reason for choosing fund-raising instead of purchasing was that the hospital procurement process is complicated, and it is difficult to complete the process in a short time, while fund-raising is much more direct.
2. The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology leads material security
Southern Weekend reporters interviewed more than 20 hospital contacts who issued announcements.
To sum up, there are 3 types of reasons for hospitals to ask for donations. One is that there is really no material; One is to plan ahead; There is another type, which is that materials were sent to Wuhan.
The staff of Gan County People's Hospital in Shaanxi Province said that their county-level hospitals usually had few protective clothing, especially anti-impact masks.
This kind of materials was not needed at ordinary times. When encountering a minor epidemic, they could be bought temporarily or borrowed from brother hospitals. However, when encountering such a national epidemic, epidemic prevention materials were not enough, and they couldn't be bought if they wanted to.
On January 25, the famous West China Hospital, Sichuan University also joined the fund-raising.
A staff of the hospital told the Southern Weekend reporter that the hospital's team that rushed to Wuhan took away most of the inventory. At present, triage, fever clinic, infection and quarantine wards all needed to consume a large amount of related supplies. The hospital vacated more than 400 beds to treat quarantined patients, so it needed to raise money.
Doctors in intensive care unit of an AAA hospital in Haikou City, Hainan Province also told Southern Weekend reporter that the existing reserve materials in the hospital were sufficient, but the medical personnel who rushed to Wuhan needed to take away some protective materials, so they donated money to the society in advance.
The staff of Hainan Provincial People's Hospital Office confirmed to Southern Weekend reporter that after SARS, the hospital quickly determined the emergency plan and prepared for the emergency in the hospital's internal treatment process. However, because the supply side resources need to give priority to the epidemic areas where the supply is scarce, "some goods we ordered have been transferred there".
At present, the goods of Hainan's reworked factories also give priority to supporting areas with serious epidemic situation.
During this epidemic situation, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology led material security
A departmental cadre of the Provincial Department of Industry and Information Technology told Southern Weekend reporter that this is because "the production of health materials is coordinated by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology".
Take Guangdong Province as an example. On January 27, the official WeChat of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology released a message that the Guangdong Provincial Department of Industry and Information Technology is the head unit of the material security group of the Guangdong Provincial Epidemic Prevention and Control Command, and is responsible for convening all members of the provincial government, the Guangdong Branch of Customs and the Red Cross Society to work together to solve the problems of enterprise resumption of production and material supply.
At the press conference of the State Council on January 26, Wang Jiangping, Vice Minister of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, revealed that in the demand list sent by Wuhan to the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, 100,000 sets of medical protective clothing are needed every day, and 3 million sets are needed per month.
However, during the Spring Festival, the rework rate of domestic protective clothing was only 40%.
However, there were only 40 qualified enterprises that meet the standards in China, which were also distributed in 14 provinces with a daily production capacity of 30,000 sets.
That is to say, all domestic compliant protective clothing enterprises were supplied to Wuhan together, and only one third of the demand could be produced in one day.
Wang Jiangping said that there are still some enterprises with export production capacity, which can produce 50,000 sets of protective clothing every day, but without the permission of Chinese standards, it will take a little time to change.
Miao Wei, Minister of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, said during an investigation in Tianjin on January 23 that China is the world's largest producer of masks, with a maximum production capacity of more than 20 million masks per day.
At present, more than 30 enterprises have resumed production, with the output reaching more than 8 million a day.
However, masks are medical consumables that can be changed for many times one day, and this production capacity was difficult to meet the demand.
On the evening of January 27, the boss of a mask manufacturer told Southern Weekend reporter that the street department in the jurisdiction had already registered.
In the face of material shortage, Wang Jiangping, deputy minister of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, also proposed 4 plans: using central reserve; do everything possible to resume work and resume production, and rapidly increase production capacity from 40%; solve the problem of convergence between export and Chinese standards. exported products that meet European and American standards can be used in China; strengthen international cooperation and promote international procurement to meet domestic needs.
So how much are the central reserves?
On January 27th, when the Southern Weekend reporter called the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology for news interview, no one answered, and the interviewed scholars and experts all said they didn't know about the emergency materials reserve.
3. The material reserve has a system and has not landed
In fact, since SARS in 2003, the system design of medical material reserve in China has already been completed.
In 2004, the revised “Law of the People's Republic of China on the Prevention and Control of Infectious Diseases” stipulated that the people's governments at or above the county level should reserve medicines, medical devices and other materials for the prevention and control of infectious diseases for use.
In the following two years, the State Council has successively formulated the “National General Emergency Plan for Public Emergencies”, “the National Emergency Plan for Public Health Emergencies”, “the National Emergency Plan for Medical and Health Rescue for Public Emergencies” and “the Guidelines for Preparing Emergency Plans for Community (Township) Emergencies for Public Health Emergencies (for Trial Implementation)”.
The above plans all pointed out that people's governments at all levels need to establish reserves of materials and production capacity for dealing with public health emergencies.
In 2016, the National Health and Family Planning Commission issued the "Thirteenth Five-Year Plan (2016-2020) for Emergency Acute Infectious Disease Prevention and Control Plan", and proposed to improve the material reserve system.
Southern Weekend reporter learned on the website of the National Health Commission that the emergency reserve work is the responsibility of CDC at all levels in China, which mainly stores emergency equipment, biological products, diagnostic reagents, disinfection drugs and protective equipment.
So why didn't these protective appliances, which had been reserved in theory, solve the problem at the critical moment?
Southern Weekend reporters inquired a large number of academic essays of several provincial CDC staff, and found that the emergency material reserves and daily management in several provinces in China were not optimistic.
In February 2019, the staff of Guizhou Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention published an article introducing the health emergency response capacity of Guizhou Province in 2017.
Among the 11 kinds of emergency materials and equipment listed in the Catalogue of Health Emergency Materials in Guizhou Province, there are only 5 kinds and 2 kinds of emergency materials and equipment with the reserve rate reaching 100% in the city and county level CDC respectively, among which the logistics support reserve, vaccine and drug reserve are obviously insufficient.
Incomplete material reserve management system is also a long-term situation.
Only 55.6% of the state-level disease control institutions in Guizhou have established the material management system and work flow, while 60.9% of them have established the material management system at the county level.
Only 22.2% of city and state-level disease control institutions have complete management records (including lists, warehousing registration, etc.), and only 18.5% of county-level disease control institutions.
In an essay published in 2016, the staff of Hainan Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention mentioned that the health departments at all levels in Hainan have formulated the catalog of health emergency materials reserve at the same level, but they have not established the mechanism for transferring health emergency materials reserve, and there is no material reserve system and management platform.
An article published by the staff of Shanxi Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention in 2015 showed that most of the existing emergency materials in the province were purchased under emergency conditions when emergencies occurred. The reserve quantity was unreasonable and the quality was single. Personal protective equipment was mainly used, and there were a large number of expired materials.
Shenzhen is a first-tier city in China. In August, 2016, the staff of CDC also published an introduction article. One conclusion was that the personal protective equipment reserve is a weak link in Shenzhen's health emergency work, which is not clearly defined from the wearing order, model type and daily maintenance, and some institutions have insufficient necessary reserve materials.
4. Inventory of total national material reserves
According to the requirements of emergency plan and other relevant regulations, the funds needed for health protection and other related materials, equipment and facilities are included in the financial budget of the government at the corresponding level.
Southern Weekend reporters combed the national financial accounts of the Ministry of Finance over the years, and found that from 2010 to 2018, the cost of emergency treatment of public health emergencies nationwide was between RMB 600 million and RMB 800 million per year.
The expenditure of emergency treatment institutions is RMB 2-3 billion.
The annual expenditure on disease prevention and control institutions was more than RMB 30 billion, but it was impossible to find out how much of it is used for medical reserves.
In December 2019, an essay published in the core “Journal Public Health and Preventive Medicine” on the eve of the outbreak showed that the physical value of all hospital reserves in Hubei Province was RMB 358,400, RMB 410,900 and RMB 670,100 in each year from 2014 to 2016.
In November 2004, more than one year after SARS, the Economic Operation Bureau of the National Development and Reform Commission made a special investigation to the emergency management department of the US Department of Homeland Security and the National Center for Disease Control and Prevention. The summary of this investigation report is still on the official website of the National Development and Reform Commission.
At that time, a conclusion was that the emergency response in the United States was backed by materials and medical supplies.
According to the report, the medical reserve funds are allocated by the government.
In order to ensure the effectiveness of the reserve supplies, they should be written off regularly and updated in time.。
Since "9.11" and "anthrax", the medical reserve budget has increased from USD 50 million to USD 600 million (about RMB 4.2 billion).
In 2017, the staff of the health and welfare department in Taiwan Province, China, made a paper entitled "Research and Analysis of International Medical Related Material Reserve System".
According to the essay, at that time, the reserve materials owned by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in the United States were worth USD 7 billion (about RMB 49 billion), and the national material distribution time was 12-48 hours.
The reserve products include more than 900 kinds of items such as antibiotics, chemical antidotes, antitoxins, vaccines, diagnostic reagents, personal protective equipment, etc., which were stored in 6 confidential storage locations.
In the same period, Canada's reserves reached USD 300 million (about RMB 2.1 billion), and Australia's reserves reached USD 200 million (about RMB 1.4 billion ).
In addition, this essay also wrote that the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention stores items with high particularity, difficulty in market circulation, or large demand in third-party logistics companies for inventory management; For easy-to-circulate goods, they shall be stored in the warehouse of the supplier for management, and the manufacturer shall circulate the products coming to the scheduled period to the market, and timely supplement new products.
In 2016, a data was quoted in the academic paper of a staff of Beijing Chaoyang District Health Planning Commission. In 2013, the scale of China's medical reserve funds reached RMB 1.2 billion, including RMB 550 million from the central government and RMB 650 million from provinces and cities.
District-county level reserves are relatively lagging behind. At that time, no statistical data about the average level of districts and counties were found.
The article also mentioned that the physical reserve in Chaoyang District of Beijing at that time was RMB 680,000.
The article wrote that the established local reserves are basically the physical reserves of personal protective equipment and disinfection medical equipment purchased urgently during SARS or H1N1 prevention and control. Some of the material reserves cannot meet the needs of current health emergency work, but also cause the waste of some emergency materials.
According to the article, health emergency and epidemic prevention materials were mostly stored by disease control institutions, but there was a lack of financial guarantee and personal protective equipment, and there was no systematic catalog for reference by executive departments.
In addition, except for limited capital reserves and production capacity reserves in some areas, they were mainly material reserves, lacking effective capital and production capacity reserves.
On the morning of January 28, Southern Weekend reporters contacted a number of hospitals seeking donations one after another.
At present, the mode of supply is rather confusing.
A person from a Guangzhou hospital told the Southern Weekend reporter, "I have been taking the note of the Health Commission to the brother hospitals without patients, and they have stocks to provide us."
A hospital in Sichuan Province said that it began to report to the Health Commission on January 24, and now it reports the consumption of consumables for 48 hours every day, but the materials reported yesterday have not yet been received.
The medical team who went to Wuhan took away N95 masks. At present, the hospital was in contact with the provincial government, asking for 400 masks, and 200 masks are allocated at present.
The Economic and Information Committee of the provincial government controls the emergency materials warehouse of China National Pharmaceutical Group Corporation, but the approval process is complicated, which requires the approval of the Economic and Information Committee at different levels. "The business is managed by the Economic and Information Committee, and it is not clear how to manage it".
A hospital in Hunan Province said that the monthly consumption is now 50,000 masks and 10,000 sets of protective clothing.These materials will be prepared by hospitals and CDC, but the quantity is not large.
At present, there have been new cases in the local area, and the hospital has received some materials from CDC, but the supply chain is in danger of breaking these days.
On the morning of January 28, they received good news that a batch of materials had been transferred from the Emergency Management Office of the Municipal Health Commission. "They were also transferred from other places, which should be transferred from top. They took them from the province and then transferred them to us".

English content:
Hello, I am Tian Jing.
Finally, we still got the bad news.
WHO announced this morning that the COVID-19 outbreak was an international public health emergency for a period of 3 months.
It will be a very long 3 months. Just like we locked down Wuhan, China will be quarantined by other countries.
Many people may say that Westerners just like to maltreat China. This time, they finally got a chance to watch the good show in China, and then they thought China had fallen into the abyss of depression.
It is undeniable that there have always been people who hate China, just like many of us, some people insist that the epidemic was poisoned by the United States.
We are all normal individuals, and it is inevitable that all kinds of negative emotions will engulf us and incite narrow nationality hatred for no reason.
However, I also hope that everyone can understand more foreigners' opinions on the current epidemic situation in China and the measures taken by the Chinese government.
If there is only one voice in the world, it will be very dangerous.
As outsiders, we stand from God's perspective and look at everything in front of our eyes carefully.
In an extraordinary period, information is like mud, so we need to calmly and independently think about it .
In the past 17 years, with two major epidemics, we still haven’t perfected epidemic prevention system and institutionalized epidemic prevention means. The people and institutions still have no rules to follow, the truth is also covered, and we still panic when something happens.
China has been the second largest economy in the world, comparing with many aspects that are leading in the world, and we still need to catch up with the epidemic prevention work concerning the safety of all mankind.
We can make progress, only by realizing this point.
1. Cheongwadae, 500,000 Koreans, petitioned for a ban on Chinese entry
Mr. Xiang Zhi, a Chinese Language Teacher in University, from South Korea   :
Because of teaching Chinese, I went to China every year for academic exchange. I have many Chinese friends and love China very much.
But this time, I feel complicated and very sad.
I pay special attention to this epidemic. Firstly, the relevant news was repeatedly broadcast, asking everyone to wear masks and wash their hands frequently. In more than 20 infectious countries, South Korea has ranked fourth, so we had to pay attention.
In addition, one case has just been confirmed in our district.
This is terrible. My father was just sent to a nursing home last month. He has been over 80 years old and has poor resistance. I am so worried about him.
I want to take my father home, but I'm not sure if it's safer to go home.
I am so struggling.
Like other Koreans, besides Korean media, I have known the epidemic situation in China from social networking sites, which is complicated and difficult to distinguish between true and false, which increases the panic about the epidemic.
There are 2 videos on the Internet that are “liked” a lot. One is the Chinese old man who walked and suddenly fell to the ground and died; One is that young Chinese women are eating bats live.
There must be some missing real information in these videos without antecedents and consequences, but normal people don't think so. Everyone believes that seeing is believing. When people suddenly fall to the ground, their intuition is that this infectious disease is terrible, and the Chinese with this disease are so terrible!
(It was later confirmed to be a rumor)。
South Korea's "Joong Ang Ilbo" reported on the 28th day that 556,000 Koreans filed a petition to Cheongwadae (the presidential palace of South Korea), demanding that "the Chinese be banned from entering the country immediately".
Just 2 days ago, the Korean Medical Doctor Association published a public talk on "Asking to consider banning Chinese from entering the country", which had a great influence on Korean people.
Now, don't mention Chinese, even for Koreans who have lived in China, and Korean people don't want them to go back.
More than 600 expatriates living in Wuhan were picked up by the Korean government on 30th and 31st.
There are 2 conditions attached to receiving expatriates:
1. "Those who don’t have Korean nationality are not allowed to board the plane";
2. "Those with fever above 37.5℃, vomiting, cough, sore throat and dyspnea are not allowed to board the plane".
That means that the Korean daughter-in-law or son-in-law in Wuhan may be forced to separate, and those who are ill can only stay in the epidemic area and seek more happiness for themselves.
Not only that, the expatriates who take back South Korea can't return to their own homes, and they need to be observed in quarantine.
At the beginning, the residents of the selected quarantined resettlement area also went to Cheongwadae to petition, and they blocked the road, and these expatriates were not allowed to settle here.
Can you understand what I said?
It means that even ordinary Korean people are afraid of their compatriots, not to mention Chinese people!
除了这些，我还特别不能理解，疫情发生后，当地政府不是及时通报，而是忙着开运动会，层层请示上级等指示，这在韩国肯定是不可能发生的。
In addition to these, I can't understand that after the outbreak, the local government was busy holding sports meetings and asking for instructions from superiors, which is definitely impossible in Korea.
Also, the government has ordered the "city lockdown". Why are there a large number of Wuhan people traveling around the world?
Chinese students in my university often say that Koreans discriminate against Chinese students. What I understand is that Chinese people generally don't abide by the laws and regulations. I don't know if China is too big and South Korea is too small. If you don't abide by the rules, it will get confused. This is our bottom line.
Although these Chinese students are not my students, I often communicate with them and tell them the rules and habits of Koreans. I think as long as we can abide by Korean rules seriously, there will be no discrimination.
At present, 4 cases have been found in Korea, all of which came back from Wuhan. If you think about it, one of them has contacted more than 300 people, and these more than 300 people have to be quarantined.
Not everyone is afraid of death. Once a small country like ours is infected, there is no way to control it, whether it is manpower or material resources.
There is also news on the Internet that this illness is not from wild animals, but from an experiment of an infectious disease research institute in Wuhan, which is a man-made disaster.
In addition, after the outbreak, the local government did not report it in time and concealed the news, which also aggravated the Korean people's suspicion of the Chinese government.
I don't know the truth of this news. After all, it hasn't determined where the virus came from until now, and many of the first infected cases haven't touched the seafood market.
In a word, I hope the Chinese government can find the source and control the epidemic as soon as possible.
No matter where the virus comes from, it is an indisputable fact that most infectious diseases come from wild animals.
I hope that Chinese people will stop eating wild animals. Every life is precious. We can't bring trouble to so many innocent people because of ourselves.
Infectious diseases are not from any country, but from all over the world. If we resist the Chinese people, the virus will not disappear.
We must unite, and every country should think like this.

2. Chinese people only believe in politics, not science
日本 翔子 新闻记者
Syoko,  Journalist from Japan   
I am a journalist in Japan. On January 1, 2020, I heard about the new pneumonia in Wuhan on WeChat and Weibo.
When I first heard that Wuhan Public Security Bureau had detained 8 "rumor mongers", I was surprised and felt how this could happen.
Anyway, this is impossible in Japan. First of all, we journalists will not agree.
At present, there have been 7 confirmed cases with new pneumonia in Japan, which have been treated in quarantine.
All 6 infected people came from Wuhan or lived in Wuhan.
A 60-year-old Japanese bus driver was added. This is the first time that Japanese people have been infected with COVID-19. Although he did not stay in Wuhan, he took Wuhan tourists by bus twice.
China and Japan are adjacent to each other, so everyone focused on it and wears masks.
However, due to the massive purchase of masks by Chinese people in the coming days, the market demand is increasing, and even out of stock in some areas.
Since the outbreak began, lots of Japanese drugstores have put up the slogan "Come on Wuhan", and the government and enterprises have donated masks and protective clothing to help Wuhan.
It also provides good services for tourists stranded in Japan, such as setting a precedent and extending short-term tourist visas for 30 days.
In an interview with Phoenix Satellite TV yesterday, the secretary-general of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan, the core figure of the Anpei regime, said that China's current situation is like a relative getting ill for Japan, and we will do our best to help.
He said that there has always been friendship between China and Japan. This sudden epidemic is like a sudden fire in a neighbor's house or illness, and a relative is sick. The Japanese want to help the whole country. The Japanese all think so and hope that the masks and protective clothing donated by Japan can play a role in this epidemic.
For this move by Japanese society and government, most people expressed their support:
"It's really good to help each other in difficult times. Now food should be in short supply, so if there is extra space (plane), even if it is instant noodles, I hope to send some."
"It is best to load some relief supplies and milk powder in the event of a disaster."
"I heard from Chinese friends that logistics has stopped, and there is no food in the supermarket. I am a little worried about what children should do, and I hope that materials and food can support more."
In this Spring Festival, I wanted to wish Chinese friends a happy Chinese New Year!
But I can't be happy in my heart. Looking at the people in Wuhan who are trapped in a quarantine, I don't know how they live during the Chinese New Year.
Also, during the Chinese New Year, the medical workers who went to the epidemic areas are the greatest people.
This incident also proves once again that Chinese people only trust the government, leaders and official media, but not science.
Many people think that politics and leaders can do anything, and as long as they have power, they can cope with any disaster.
I don't think that's actually the case.
There is not an invulnerable system, and even the most powerful system has its weaknesses.
During SARS, some weaknesses of Chinese system still existed.
For example, local governments are waiting for their superiors, while local leaders are waiting for the leadership of the central government. It seems that before the central government expresses, local governments cannot do anything or admit the epidemic crisis.
Therefore, concealing the news, lax and lazy politics, as if everything was normal, nothing happened.
After the epidemic spread and the higher-level government and leaders focus on it, local governments took action.
Hubei provincial government and Wuhan municipal government, as local governments, are accustomed to their own situation of being struggling, habitually accepting the command of the central government, habitually falling into the old-fashioned report, and delaying the best time for prevention and control without receiving the instructions from the central government.
These are created under different political systems. In a word, it is difficult for us to understand, but it does exist.
3. In Spain, wearing a mask will be discriminated against
Brenell     Athlete from Spain     
I am French, but I live in Spain, so I don't know how many people are infected in France. There were suspected cases in Spain before, but they were ruled out later.
I heard about COVID-19 before Christmas, and it was reported on TV and Instagram.
However, I only looked at it and didn't know much about it. I only knew that many people began to discriminate against Chinese people because of this incident.
Previously, a woman from Wuhan showed off on the social network, saying that she had symptoms such as fever and cough, but relieved the symptoms with drugs, and successfully passed the fever test at the French airport to enter the country.
She also uploaded photos of herself dining in a Michelin-starred restaurant in France.
It is said that Chinese netizens reported her.
The Chinese Embassy also confirmed that the woman had contacted the French emergency department and had her body temperature measured.
It is reported that the woman left Wuhan where COVID-19 outbreak before the flight took off.
This kind of selfish behavior makes foreigners misunderstand Chinese seriously, which is very bad.
TV media reports are quite objective statements of facts, but on social networking sites such as Twitter and IG, there are some public opinion-oriented information, some of which are even discriminatory.

For example, Twitter had a post reprinted. A Chinese woman in Tik Tok is drinking bat soup. This video was praised a lot. I also saw a video of a Chinese dipping in tomato sauce and eating live mice. It's disgusting.
(In fact, it is a rumor)
At present, in the streets of Spain, there are only a few Asian faces wearing masks, while others don't. After all, they are far away from us and have little influence.
Chinese students around me store masks, but they don't dare to wear them outside, because it will lead to discrimination.
They are Asian faces. If they wear masks, others will think that she has been infected with the virus and will avoid them.
Another friend traveled to France, coughed twice on the train, and all the people around him moved far away.
Of course, I also have Chinese friends who insist on wearing masks every day and never care about other people's opinions. They are very brave.

I hope China can develop the vaccine as soon as possible. After all, China has a large population, which is really scary to spread.

4. Without proper propaganda, how can people cooperate with the government's work
韩国 俊杰 商人
 Jun Jie, Businessman from South Korea       
I am a Korean, but I have lived in China for 20 years before I returned to South Korea after the financial crisis. China is relatively concerned.
At the beginning of January this year, watching Korean TV news, I learned that there was unknown pneumonia in Wuhan.
Looking at online media on the 20th, I predicted at that time that it might be SARS virus.
I didn't expect it to be so serious later, and I was always nervous about seeing medical supplies.
This made me wonder China is so rich in materials and masks loved by other countries are all made in China, and why China is always lack of masks?
Are there so many materials that can't reach the front line of the hospital?
For this epidemic situation, not to mention the Chinese people, even I was very angry when I watch them, and the people's right to know was seriously deprived!
Without proper propaganda, how can people cooperate with the government's work
Later, after the lockdown of the city, I also watched a video of the police smashing the chess room, which was incredible.
Koreans' feelings towards China have always been complicated, because of the THAAD incident, Koreans have bad feelings towards China, and there is always negative news about China.
Anyway, there are many bad comments about China on the Internet, and there is basically no special discrimination against Chinese people in reality.
For Koreans in Wuhan, China, the government has sent 2 charter flights to take them home.
After returning to South Korea, they will be quarantined from the outside and tested for 14 days.
At the beginning, the people in the quarantine area did not accept these expatriates, but the impact was not great. The government had already negotiated a solution, after all, it was still people of our own country.
Considering the urgent need of medical supplies in Wuhan, the Korean government provided 2 million masks, 1 million medical masks, 100,000 protective clothing and 100,000 pairs of protective goggles.
Some of these materials will be shipped to Wuhan by chartered plane to meet overseas Chinese.
Speaking of Wuhan, what impressed me most was that I was very moved and shocked to watch Wuhan people standing on the balcony singing the national anthem.
Although Chinese people are usually weak in playing football, the spirit of fighting virus is extremely strong. We can feel it from their singing voice, which has to be admired.
This incident has a great impact on all countries. On January 28, the first day after the Spring Festival holiday in South Korea, the stock price of Seoul financial market opened sharply reduced by more than 3%, and the exchange rate of KRW to USD rose sharply.
Come on!
Chinese people are so tenacious, nothing can't be overcome!

5. China's remedial measures to deal with the epidemic are beyond most countries
泰国 Nara saka 日本旅行社社长
Nara Saka    Manager of Japanese Travel Agency, from Thailand    
I've been doing the ground pick-up service in Japan and Thailand. In recent years, Chinese outbound travel has been very popular, especially in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand, so I pay more attention to China.
Probably one day before the Chinese New Year's Eve, I accidentally saw the news of viruses appearing in Wuhan, because I didn't feel much serious because of my ignorance of medical knowledge.
However, on New Year's Eve, I received a message for help from a friend in Wuhan who worked in the United States and hoped that I could mobilize the Thai business community to donate masks to support Wuhan.
At that time, I felt that the situation was serious. I quickly contacted various organizations in Thailand, hoping to help.
But to my surprise, the masks that my friends want most have been snapped up by Chinese people in Thailand, including the countryside like Chiang Rai, and the store also says: The masks are out of stock.
I went to several hospitals in Thailand, but none of them had masks, or there were a few, which was not enough for donation.
I seldom face this kind of powerless situation, and I felt very sorry for not helping my friends.
I looked at the statistics, because of the sudden outbreak, more than 20,000 Wuhan people were stranded in Thailand during the Spring Festival.
At present, all the cases found are Chinese tourists, and only one is a Thai citizen who has been to Wuhan.
I don't know if it's the climate. Anyway, these cases in Thailand are either cured or get better without death.
I also saw all kinds of comments about China on the Internet. Generally, it started to be much more negative, and slowly returned to rationality.
For example, they don't like hygiene, like eating wild animals, the local government's inaction, concealing the truth of the epidemic situation, and so on.
China's huge system, we can't deny its defects, there is no perfect social system in the world.
Therefore, we can't just stare at the defects, but look at a series of remedial measures and efforts made by the government irrationally.

For example, ordering the lockdown of the city to cut off the source of infection, it is the most important festival for Chinese people during the Spring Festival, and it is also the time when activities are most frequent. To make this decision and put it in place, it needs strong administrative ability, which most countries can't do.
For example, a hospital dedicated to treating this disease should be built within a week. I watched the live video on the Internet, and the scene was too shocking. It was not only a lot of manpower, material resources and financial resources, but also needed strict organization and management to make the construction period go smoothly.
In addition, China quickly dispatched military doctors to Wuhan immediately, and countless doctors and nurses from all over the country took the initiative to write applications and went to Wuhan for treatment. They were really brave.
I have traveled all over the world, and I have lived in Japan for more time than in Thailand. I can feel the progress and development of China in all aspects. As long as the highest level gives an order, the response speed to the epidemic is faster than that of any other country.
This is something that our country cannot do.
